intro: Epicharis leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte epicharis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
